places_to_visit.name: Eiffel Tower
places_to_visit.description: The Eiffel Tower, an iconic symbol of Paris, offers stunning views from its observation decks. The summit provides a panoramic view of the city, while the second floor offers a closer look at Paris’s landmarks. The surrounding Champ de Mars Gardens are perfect for a leisurely stroll and a great spot for photos.

places_to_visit.name: Louvre Museum
places_to_visit.description: The Louvre Museum is the world’s largest art museum and a historic monument in Paris. It houses thousands of works of art, including Leonardo da Vinci’s Mona Lisa and the Venus de Milo. The Egyptian Antiquities collection and the Grand Gallery, featuring masterpieces from various periods, are highlights of this iconic museum.

places_to_visit.name: Notre-Dame Cathedral
places_to_visit.description: Notre-Dame Cathedral, a masterpiece of Gothic architecture, is renowned for its impressive façade, stunning rose windows, and intricate stone carvings. Although it was damaged by fire in 2019, its historical and architectural significance remains a major attraction. Sainte-Chapelle, located nearby, is famous for its breathtaking stained glass windows.

places_to_visit.name: Montmartre
places_to_visit.description: Montmartre is a historic district known for its artistic heritage. The Sacré-Cœur Basilica, perched on the highest point in Paris, offers panoramic views of the city. Place du Tertre is a lively square where artists display their work. The iconic Moulin Rouge and the serene Montmartre Cemetery, the resting place of many famous artists, are also notable landmarks.

places_to_visit.name: Champs-Élysées and Arc de Triomphe
places_to_visit.description: The Champs-Élysées is one of the most famous avenues in the world, known for its high-end shops, cafes, and theaters. At its western end stands the Arc de Triomphe, a monumental arch honoring those who fought and died for France. Nearby, Place de la Concorde is a historic square with impressive fountains and obelisks.

places_to_visit.name: Palace of Versailles
places_to_visit.description: The Palace of Versailles, a UNESCO World Heritage site, is renowned for its opulent architecture and stunning gardens. The Hall of Mirrors is a highlight, reflecting the grandeur of the French monarchy. The extensive Versailles Gardens, Grand Trianon, and Petit Trianon provide a glimpse into the royal lifestyle and exquisite landscape design.

activities: Guided tours of major landmarks
Cruise on the Seine River
Visit to historic neighborhoods
Dining at renowned Parisian restaurants
tips_and_tricks: Purchase tickets for major attractions in advance to avoid long lines.
Wear comfortable walking shoes as Paris is best explored on foot.
Learn a few basic French phrases to enhance your experience.
Keep an eye on your belongings, especially in crowded areas.
